header.div: Latest updates and information regarding the Coronavirus (COVID-19)

section.p: Just now, Governor Baker extended the school closures through the end of the 19-20 school year.

This year continues to be unique in so many ways, and this extension will present its own set of challenges. While not what we hoped for or ever expected this year, I have faith in our community that we will be OK! We will certainly miss being in classrooms, on stages and fields with our students, but I believe we will continue to find newer and stronger ways to support our students as they learn and grow.

As mentioned, we began planning for Phase Three last week. I know there will be many questions, concerns, and suggestions over the next several days, and we welcome your input. The administrative team will be meeting and discussing how we will move forward, stay strong, and stay connected.

Keeping our focus on the core of who we are as students, staff, and families, we WILL get through this! I have seen how the Stoughton community comes together in times of difficulty. And I know, "We've got this Knights!"
PS. And Seniors, we really do love you and we will make sure you are celebrated!!

hr.p: Some quick updates for this week.

- Governor Baker is speaking between 12 and 1pm today and will provide more information on the length of school closures. The Administrative Team has been preparing for different scenarios and we will be ready for the next steps, whatever they may be. Further communication will follow in the coming days with any specifics announced by the governor today.

- Food distribution will be Tuesday, Wednesday, and Friday this week. Regular sized portions on Tuesday, and then doubles on Wednesday and Friday. Next week we will go back to Monday, Wednesday, Friday.

- Chromebooks. If you need help with a Chromebook, please go to spstechhelp.com and the tech team will help you remotely or you can arrange for a trade. Please do not come to OMS without having spoken to your school principal or a tech staff member beforehand. Thanks!

- Phase Two Learning. We are working through this week so please be on the lookout for assignments and Meets Tues-Fri. While students should be working a couple of hours each day on the assignments that teachers are presenting, the most important thing is to make sure that everyone is safe and taking good care. We know that remote learning is not easy, but the plan is designed to be flexible and the hard work of teachers, specialists, paras and, importantly, parents/guardians is really wonderful!! If students need support, please reach out to a teacher, counselor, or administrator.

- Seniors. We love you! And we are going to do whatever we can to make this end-of-year special, knowing that it’s going to be different than what we hoped. Ms. Miller and the SHS team are working hard to give the Class of 2020 a great send-off. More info to come soon.
- Super’s Stories at Seven will feature a special guest tonight! https://youtu.be/ND1B8MtIRVw

You all are doing great! These are tough times, but the kindness and support I’m seeing across Stoughton is pretty remarkable! Keep reaching out to your friends and neighbors, and we will keep supporting you all as best as we can!
